direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First -- have you found me a crew?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, there's a hard tale, Jack. Most of the decent pirates in town won't sail with you -- seem to think you're a jinx.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now where, I wonder, would they have gotten that idea? Gibbs evades answering by taking a long sip. Jack leans forward. Gibbs leans forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going after the Black Pearl. Gibbs straightens up like he's been hit. He stares. He reaches for the drink as if to down it -- but then sets it back down. He leans forwards again. Jack has not moved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ilm going after the Black Pearl. I know where its going to be, and I'm going to take it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack, it's a fool's errand: You've heard the tales they tell about the Pearl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aye, and that's why I know where it's going to be, and that's why I know what Barbossa is up to. All I need is a crew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shakes his head) A fool's errand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not if the fool has something Barbossa wants. Something he needs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you've got that, have you? ANGLE ON: Jack, as he smiles enigmatically, and shifts his eyes' -- behind him, Will, still on guard, glares a sailor away from the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back there, guarding the door is the son of old Bootstrap Bill Turner. Gibbs' eyes widen over the edge of the tankard. Peers at Will. Then smiles, with more missing teeth than good ones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, lookee there. I'll allow you may be onto something, Jack. (considers, nods) There's bound to be sailors on this rock crazy as you. I'll find some men. Gibbs downs the drink, SLAMS the tankard on the table. Will reacts to the sound, draws both sword and dagger, kicks over a table for cover, and whirls on anyone who moves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kid's a bit of a stick, isn't he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That he is. EXT. TORTUGA - DOCK - LATER - DAY On the docks, a disheveled, motley and weatherbeaten group of about a dozen swabs stand in a ragged line-up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Feast your eyes, Cap'n. All of 'em good sea-faring men, faithful hands before the mast, every one worth his salt -- (sotto, making his point)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and crazy, to boot. Jack holds up a hand -- enough. He moves down the line, Gibbs at his side. Then he notices AnaMaria in line, dressed like a man, He raises an eyebrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You owe me a boat. Jack nods, continues. One sailor is quite fat, another thin and sickly. Jack is not happy with his choices. He stops in front of COTTON, a short sailor with a large, colorful PARROT on his shoulder. Jack raises an eyebrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cotton here is mute, sir. Poor devil had his tongue cut out -- Cotton opens his mouth to show this -- Jack grimaces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- so he went and trained the parrot to do the talking for him, nobody knows how. Nobody knows the parrot's name, neither, so we just call it 'Cotton's parrot.' Jack decides to test this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Cotton. Do you have the courage and fortitude to follow orders and stay true, in the face danger, and almost certain death? Cotton lifts the parrot off his shoulder, raises it -- COTTON'S PARROT Wind in your SAILS! Wind in your SAILS!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mostly, that seem to mean 'yes.' Cotton nods vigorously, lowers the parrot, and it goes silent. Jack shakes his head. Steps back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That goes for the rest of you! Danger and near certain death. (turns away) For we are to sail for the Isla de Muerta, to rescue the daughter of Governor Swann. An equal share of the reward shall be - Jack hears movement, looks back -- several potential crew members back away in fright; first one, then another, turn and run, followed by more. Soon just a half dozen are left, including Cotton (with parrot) -- and AnaMaria.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up, before you lose them all!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are the only ones worth having. (glances at the sky) And we're going to need them- EXT. H. M. S. INTERCEPTOR - DAY A FLASH of lightening and the CRACK of thunder. The canvas of every sail is stretched taut. The ship rocks as it drops into the valley of huge swell, climbs up the other side. On board, the new crew members scurry about their tasks, pulling lines and trimming sails. Excellent sailors, it takes everything they have to keep the ship afloat. AnaMaria is at the helm. Gibbs staggers along the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That fool will have us lose the canvas, and the masts besides! On Jack, a ROARING wind blowing back his hair, eyes intent on their course. Gibbs climbs the tilted deck toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Werd best drop canvas, sirl
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She can hold a bit longer. The wind picks up, howling. Jack smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shouts) What's in your head to put you in such a fine mood?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shouts) We're catching up! Jack turns back to the sea, enjoying himself. Gibbs stares at him like he's a crazy man.' INT. BLACK PEARL - CAPTAIN'S CABIN - DAY The sound of RAIN pounds down on the deck above - - then suddenly stops. Elizabeth moves to the stern windows, looks out at the rolling sea below -- no escape there. She hears the sound of a VQICE calling, gazes up, wondering - EXT. BLACK PEARL - CROW' S NEST - DAY High on the main mast, Twigg cups his hands to his face, calls down:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isla de Muerta! Isla de Muerta, off the port bow! ON DECK, Barbossa moves to the rail. The storm clouds are breaking up. On the horizon is a dark, ominous shape: ISLA DE MUERTA. Mostly sheer unfriendly cliffs that shoot straight into the water. It is surrounded by a slate grey sea. Barbossa grasps the rail with both hands, his expression a mixture of loathing and fear. Jacoby approaches, hesitant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Orders, Captain?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring her in, not too close. I won't brave the reef, not until high tide. We lay anchor before dark. Jacoby nods, backs away. Barbossa continues to stare -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... that is, if it first doesn't sink back down to hell from where it came. EXT. CARIBBEAN SEA - DAY The Interceptor, on open waters, glorious, her white sails set wing-to-wing. EXT. H.M.S. INTERCEPTOR - DAY CLOSE ON: Jack's compass, cradled in both hands. Jack leans over and studies it -- almost like he's praying. ON THE COMPASS -- the face shows old-fashioned rose petal style direction markers below a quivering indicator that settles on -- southeast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bear three points starboard. AnaMaria turns the wheel, adjusting course. The ship leans into the new direction. Jack looks down - ON THE COMPASS -- where the indicator spins, reverses, settles on -- northeast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Six points port! AnaMaria frowns, but follows the order, turns the wheel back, and the ship responds. Will works on deck, coiling a rope -- but he watches Jack and AnaMaria, clearly not happy. Gibbs hobbles up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Left handed-ropes are coiled against the sun, or it's bad luck! (twirls a finger) Anty-clockwise. Gibbs takes over the task. The ship shifts course again. Will has had enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do we expect to find an island no one can find -- with a compass that doesn't work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, lad, just because it don't point north don't mean it don't work. (voice low) That compass gives bearings to the Isla de Muerta, wherever it may lie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? (moves closer) So ... what's the story on the pistol? Gibbs settles in, happy to have a willing listener.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell lee. Now, Jack Sparrow has an honest streak in him, and that's where the whole problem starts. This was when he was Captain of the Black Pearl -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? He never told me that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah -- he's learned, then. Plays things more close to the vest. See, Jack was a cartographer, back in Old England. Somehow I he came by the money to commission the Pearl. Hired himself a crew, promised each man an equal share. (lowers his voice) So, they're forty days out, and the First Mate says, everything's an equal share, that should mean the location of the island, too. So Jack gave up the bearings. (shakes his head) That night, there was mutiny. Gibbs voice is a whisper, now, so Will has to lean closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack gave hisself up for the sake of his loyal crewmen. He was marooned on an island, left there to die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did he get off the island?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (loud) I didn't! Will and Gibbs jump. Jack is right there beside them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My body's still there, rotting away, and I am but a ghost! Will and Gibbs aren't sure what to make of that. Jack laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you get off the island?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, that's a dark and unpleasant tale, best left untold. He starts off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait -- what about the pistol?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pistol. When a pirate is marooned, Will, he's given a pistol with a single shot. No good for hunting, or surviving, really. But after three weeks of starvation and thirst -- the option of that pistol begins to look good. Jack lets this sink in. He pulls out the pistol, raises it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I survived. And I still have that single shot. It's meant for one man. My mutinous first mate -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barbossa. Jack shoots a glance at Will -- nods, and moves away. EXT. ISLA DE MUERTA - CAVE ENTRANCE - EVENING On Barbossa, face upturned. No expression in his eyes. Around him a group of pirates, Elizabeth among them, stand as still as stones, in front of a dark cave opening. Their faces look upward, their total lack of movement disconcerting. Above the cave, on a hillock, the pirate Koehler gazes out toward the horizon. Slowly he TRANSFORMS, head-to-toe, from pirate to SKELETON- The MOON has climbed free of the storm clouds, rising large. and full on the horizon. The skeleton turns -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moonrise, Captain! First night of full.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hah! (to the pirates) Be mindful of pits and crevasses. Stay together. He takes a torch. Moves into the cave. The pirates follow. INT. ISLA DE MUERTE -     CAVES    - NIGHT The group keeps together under the firelight. The path leads between boulders on a slope downhill. From the echoes and shadows, it's clear the cave system must be huge. Elizabeth glances over -- the torches illumine caverns off to the side -- and just the edge of a mound of coins. Clearly there is more, but the rest is lost in darkness. Twigg, gazing upward in wonder, moves a few feet away from the group. Barbossa grabs him as he nears a chasm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Careful, mate. Fall down there, you'd die and miss Judgement Day -- for not even the Lord himself'll come look for you here. Barbossa lets go, and moves on, descending down, twisting and turning, but always down - EXT. H.M.S. INTERCEPTOR - NIGHT Cotton pulls a sail line, looks out -- sees something. He lifts the parrot off his shoulder, strokes it along the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Land HO! Land HO! LAND ho! LAND ho! Indeed, the faint outline of Isla de Muerta is in the distance on the port side. Will stands, excited, jumps onto the rigging for a better look. But AnaMaria, at the helm, stares at Cotton, and the parrot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How does he do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll be anchored on the lee side. Haul your wind, and keep to the weather of the island - INT. ISLA DE MUERTE - CAVES - NIGHT Flickering torchlight. Pirates stoop low to enter a cavern - -- and revealed is the spectacular treasure of Isla de Muerta: overflowing ,chests of coins, gold and silver ingots, jewelry, objects d' art, jade and ivory, brightly colored silks, furniture, jewels and pearls; mirrors and swords -anything and everything of value that might be carried by ship, is here. The pirates move through, Elizabeth can't help but gaze in wonder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The curse drove you to gather this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aye. And not a bit of it any use to us, only hoarded. But it will drive us no longer. Elizabeth pauses, staring at herself in a jewel-encrusted mirror -- and then is pushed along by the pirates. EXT. ISLA DE MUERTE - LAGOON - NIGHT The Interceptor lies at anchor in the distance. Closer, Jack and will row away from the larger vessel in a small longboat, toward the rocky shore. The RUSH of a waterfall grows louder. Will looks: ahead of them is a black CAVE MOUTH, right at water level.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Depends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On whether the stories are    all true. If they are, that's    a waterfall that spills over    at high tide, with a short drop to    an underground lagoon. If not    - By now, the moving water tugs on the longboat, and they are sucked in -- JACK (CONT'D) -- well, too late. The boat rushes forward, plunges into the darkness - INT. CAVES - UNDERWATER LAGOON - NIGHT -- the longboat takes a harrowing drop over a short waterfall ... but then lands safely in a gorgeous underwater lagoon, floats lazily toward a sandy shore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chalk one up for the stories. Will leaps out into the water, pulls the boat ashore - INT. CAVES - BED CAVERN - NIGHT The pirate group reaches the end of a small chamber of mostly jewels and pearl piled around a large bed - INT. CAVES - MAIN CAVERN - NIGHT -- and then emerge into the largest cavern of all, also crammed with treasure, including several mountains of gold coins that reach the ceiling. Treasure everywhere - Except for one spot in the center. A hole in the ceiling lets in a column of moonlight, which illumines: A stone chest, lid pushed back, decorated with carved Aztec glyphs, filled with gold coins identical to Will's medallion. A sharp stone knife lies on top. In front of it, buried in the sand is a skeleton -- and this one doesn't look like it's going to move ever again, judging by the sword in its back. A crab scurries away from it as the group approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here we stand before the cursed treasure of Cortez himself. Won by blood, it demands blood in return. All eyes turn -- onto Elizabeth. Pintle takes the stone knife from the chest, approaches her. Elizabeth shrinks back, but is held by two other pirates. Pintel grins. Grabs her by the wrist. She turns her head away, shuts her eyes. Pintle raises the knife ... ... and then very carefully, daintily, uses just the sharp tip of the knife to just prick! Elizabeth's finger. One tiny red drop of blood appears, and drips down onto the medallion. Elizabeth opens her eyes, surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you expect? We're all gentlemen here, right and proper. The pirates laugh. Barbossa takes the medallion, grins at Elizabeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know the first thing I'm going to do after the curse is lifted? (grins) Eat a whole bushel of apples. Barbossa approaches the chest, shining in the beam of moonlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was begun by blood, let blood now end! He tosses the gold medallion onto the others. The pirates tense, waiting, expectant. A long beat. They all look at each other, look at themselves. Nothing happens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did it work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't feel no different.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do we tell? Barbossa frowns, draws his pistol, and SHOOTS the pirate next to him -- Jacoby -- square in the chest. Jacoby reacts in shock, grabs his chest ... but doesn't die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. (realizes) He shot me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It didn't work! The curse is still upon us! Barbossa searches his mind for an answer ... turns to Elizabeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You. Maid. Your father. What was his name?! (grabs her roughly) Was your father William Turner?! Elizabeth takes time to smile before answering:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. The pirates cry out in alarm. Barbossa gathers himself, getting his rage under steely control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's his child? The child that sailed from England eight years ago, the child who is the real owner of that medallion, the child in whose veins flows the blood of William Turner?! Where? Barbossa SLAPS her hard across the face, sending her sprawling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Pintel) You brought us the wrong person!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She had the medallion! She's the right age. She said her name was Turner!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Barbossa) You brought us here for nothing? Barbossa whirls on him -- BARBOSSA If you had sailed with Morgan for ten years like I have, you'd know not to question me! Elizabeth sits up, watching the pirates argue, for a moment unnoticed. Suddenly, a scabbard comes down, right above her. Startled, Elizabeth looks up -- -- Will is at the top of a mound of coins, reaching down with his scabbard for her to grab onto. Elizabeth quickly leans forward, takes the bloodied medallion from the pile. Reaches back, grabs the scabbard. Will pulls her up -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If any coward here dare challenge me, let him speak! Any more talk, I'll chain ye to a cannon and send ye to the watery depths! A sound catches his attention -- coins falling. He looks up, sees Will and Elizabeth at the top of the treasure stack. ATOP THE STACK, Will grabs a large shield, flings them forward -- the two ride down the mountain of coins on the far side, slide through a small opening - INT. ISLA DE MUERTE - SMALL CAVERN - NIGHT Behind them, loose coins from their slide come down in an avalanche, sealing the entrance. Elizabeth jumps up, silver platter in hand, ready to swing -Jack catches her before she can do any damage. They recognize each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're in league with Barbossa!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm -- rescuing you. Elizabeth can't comprehend that one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You?! Will gains his footing in the rubble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Swann! We're here to rescue you! (sounds of pursuit, approaching) It's going badly!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This way! They race off, toward a bit of moonlight - EXT. ISLA DE MUERTE - NIGHT The three climb up a dark crevasse that leads out onto the island. Will takes Elizabeth's hand, helps her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad we got here in time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Truthfully -- you were a bit late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The trick isn't getting here, it's getting away. As if on cue, they hear the yells of pirates, coming closer. They take off - EXT. ISLA DE MUERTE - CLEARING - NIGHT The three race through the rocks, the sounds of pursuit close behind. Suddenly Jack stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. This won't work. (a quick decision) I'll stay behind, and fight them. You go on. Will and Elizabeth stare at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll lead them away. The sounds are closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go to the opposite end of the island, and signal the ship. I'll keep 'em busy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you sure? Jack -- this is not something you have to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure. When you've led the kind of life I have, there are debts that must be paid. Maybe I can balance the scales a little. Will nods, hesitates... gives Jack his sword - - now Jack has two, ..one for each hand. Elizabeth gives him a quick kiss. Will and Elizabeth race away, and are gone. Jack watches them for a moment, turns to face the pirates. He sticks the two swords in the ground, crossed. Leans casually against a rock. A group of pirates round a corner, cutlasses drawn, ready to fight -- but Jack raises his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I invoke the right of parlay, according to the Code of the Brethren, set down by the pirates Morgan and Bartholomew... EXT. ISLA DE MUERTE - NIGHT Jack stands before Barbossa, surrounded by pirates. Jack has a wide smile on his face -- and Barbossa doesn't like it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm inclined to kill you now, Jack Sparrow, without so much as a word, if you don't lose that grin from your face. Jack's smile remains. Barbossa puts a hand to his cutlass -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The woman's blood didn't work, did it? Barbossa hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know who's blood you need, to end the curse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say the name, or I slit your throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No you won't. Barbossa nods. Pintel steps forward, puts a blade to Jack's throat. Jack's smile widens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now. (Pintel grins) No, don't kill him. Surprised, Pintel lowers his cutlass. Jack's expression hasn't changed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allow me the humor of listening to your terms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Simple. I have something you want more than anything. The way to free you from the curse of the treasure. You have something I want -- more than anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Pearl? (laughs) Oh, that's fine. And just how do you expect this to work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You give me the Pearl. Then I tell you who you need. Barbossa stares at him, incredulous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's your offer? You, sailing away nice and pretty with the Black Pearl, and all I have is a name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm supposed to ... trust you? The pirates laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a man of my word. The pirates laugh louder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see, I've got this honest streak in me
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in its own way, a sort of curse. Oh, and there's the fact that you have no choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll torture it out of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You left me on a desert island -- what worse can you do? Jack is still smiling, intentionally smug now. Barbossa sees his options dwindling, begins to pace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blast you! I'll throw you in prison.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait as long as you like.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're setting me up for a double cross, you with the ship, and me with nothing more than your word!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's say I tell you the wrong person. What would you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Track you down and - He sees where Jack is headed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if I tell you the truth, you become mortal, and you won't come near me because you know I'd kill you. Barbossa hesitates. The pirates are amazed at how the tide has turned; Barbossa has gone past considering the idea, and might even do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack, I don't trust you, and that's a fact. Never trust a smiling man, you can lay to that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, that's where we're different. I trust you ... to do what it takes to get what you want.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're playing this as close to the edge as any man, I'll give you that. (decides, smiles) We might just have to sign articles, you and I. Jack, you're a pirate at heart, that's certain. Jack nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pintel ... set sail. If this fool plan is to work, we'll need the medallion, and that means catching the ship which brought 'em here. Jack is caught completely off guard. For the first time, his smile fades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What -- you don't have the medallion?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That fool woman took it. You be careful around her, Jack -- she's pretty enough, she'll steal your heart -- but pure evil inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll watch my back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bosun! Set up Mr. Sparrow's quarters, nice and fine ... in the brig. (to Jack, a smile) Meaning no disrespect, of course. Jack nods, and is taken away. Barbossa stares after him, not hiding his mistrust. EXT. INTERCEPTOR - DAY At full sail, headed out to sea. Gibbs glances at Elizabeth and Will, talking alone on the forecastle -- shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two women on board? A man don't have to be superstitious to know that's trouble. Elizabeth holds the medallion, and finishes her tale:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... you were in danger ... so I took the medallion. And I've kept it ever since. They thought I was you, that they needed my blood. And it didn't work. She hands him the medallion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would my father send this to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To keep it away from them? No pirate would sail to London, for fear of Execution Dock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I had known-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (anticipating him)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: then we never would have met. Will nods. They hold each other's gaze a moment. Will turns away first, leans on the rail. Looks out to sea, back the direction they came.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't believe he would make such a sacrifice for us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess you can never truly know someone else's heart. Will glances at her, and nods. AT THE HELM, Gibbs peers forward, scanning the horizon. There is a tiny island in front of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shift your heading, steer clear of that island. Fifteen degrees starboard. On the aft deck, Cotton concentrates on his work, securing a halyard. Suddenly Cotton's parrot flaps its wings, takes off, lands on the starboard bulwark, squawking -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead men tell NO tales! Dead men tell
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: tales! Dead men tell NO tales! Cotton looks up - on the horizon, following: black sails. Gibbs and AnaMaria appear, and see the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can we outrun them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a chance. Make for the reef. EXT. CARIBBEAN OCEAN - DAY Miles of blue water. The Interceptor tacks, leaving a long white wake. The Black Pearl matches it -- gaining. EXT. BLACK PEARL - DAY Barbossa and Pintel eye the Interceptor, two hounds chasing the fox.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's he doing? Is he going to run her aground? EXT. INTERCEPTOR - DAY The Black Pearl is now close behind the Interceptor -- and the Interceptor is headed for the island.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drop the forward anchor! A SAILOR at the stern of the ship pulls a release, and the ship's anchor races down into the water, the metal chain jumping and twisting on deck. The chain stops, and the Sailor locks it - EXT. CARIBBEAN SEA - DAY With its forward momentum and the anchor down, the Interceptor to turn quickly, pivoting around the anchor. EXT. BLACK PEARL - DAY Barbossa and Pintel watch as the huge ship brings its cannons to bear right in front of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All hands! Prepare to come about! But for now, the Interceptor has the advantage, and takes it: its cannons boom, and cannonballs rain down. INT. BLACK PEARL - BRIG - DAY Jack sees what he can out the porthole. In the cell with him is Twigg, acting as a guard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't hit my ship! I mean, kill the lying scoundrel - (to Twigg) I'm a little conflicted, here. Twigg just stares. EXT. INTERCEPTOR - DAY Elizabeth watches  as the Black Pearl comes about -- and then there is the  low, loud RUMBLE of two dozen cannons firing as one. The  Interceptor is hit. A barrage of shots follow; most find  their mark. Sailors dive for cover, leaving their cannons; clearly they are overmatched. EXT. BLACK PEARL - PORT SIDE - DAY Barbossa laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Strike your colors, you bloody cockroaches! EXT. INTERCEPTOR - DAY Another round of fire; Barbossa shows no mercy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like they mean to send us under.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There -- she's raised the Jolly Roger, upside down. AnaMaria, Gibbs, Cotton, even Elizabeth -- all know what this means. Will doesn't. He looks to Gibbs for an explanation:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a signal. If we resist, it won't just be death. There'll be torture as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not going to just surrender! GIBBS That we are. The Black Pearl fires again, a double-ball shot with a chain connecting the two. It hits the main mast dead ani a CRACKING, SPLINTING sound as it breaks, falls to the deck. Barbossa moves his ship alongside, preparing to board.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can at least fight -- we might be able to kill a few-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will -- it'll go worse for us -- for Elizabeth, especially -- if we fight. Will stares -- and nods. But his expression is still defiant. The deck slants; the ship is sinking. pirates swarm across on ropes, and take control of the Interceptor. EXT. BLACK PEARL - MAIN DECK - DAY The top masts of the H.M.S. Interceptor sink into the smooth' crystal waters of the Caribbean - -- as Will and Elizabeth, held by pirates, are brought before Barbossa -- and see that Jack stands beside him, manacled. Gibbs, AnaMaria and Cotton and the other crewmembers huddle together. Barbossa's wrath falls on Elizabeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome back, Miss. Last time on board, you played me right clever, make pretending and all. I hope your stay this time is more pleasant. Boys, show her some hospitality! He shoves her into a group of pirates; they yell their approval. She is pushed from one to another. This goads Will to action. He head-butts the pirate behind him, grabs a pistol, waves it at the pirates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She goes free! Will leaps onto the ship's rail. He steadies himself with a hand on the rigging. Points the pistol at Barbossa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's in your head, boy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She. Goes. Free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got one shot -- and we can't die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't. I can. He leans out over the ocean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Jack pushes forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will -- don't do anything stupid! Don't say anything stupid -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is Will Turner, the son of Bootstrap Bill Turner. His blood runs in my veins. (raises the gun to his head) You need my blood. And on my word I will pull this trigger, and sink all the way down to Davy Jones' Locker! Pintel squints at Will; the pirates murmur surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's true - he's the spittin' image of old Bootstrap. Even talks the same! Jack drops his head. Barbossa grins at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like you're back to having nothing to offer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And hers got Old Bill's courage. A curse on him, and you! Barbossa steps forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enough of that! (to Will) Name your terms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elizabeth goes free!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got that part. Anything else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Jack. And the crew. Free and unharmed. I f you agree... then... I will remain with you. Barbossa considers; his crew waits. Finally -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agreed. You have my word, as a gentleman of fortune -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will -- you can't trust him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must swear by the Holy Bible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eh? You have my word, then -- on the Good Book, I do swear, and the Lord spare my worthless soul. Barbossa crosses himself, as do many of his men. Will lowers the gun ... steps down -- the pirates surround him. They snatch away the pistol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boatswain! Take your captives belowdecks. Chain them in the galley, and teach 'em how to row. Gibbs, AnaMaria, Cotton and the rest are led away under guard. Barbossa looks out to sea, toward the islet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hah. Look there. That's the very same island we made Jack governor of on our last trip. (nods") When you sail the open sea as long as
direction.name: direction
